sen.j: 後藤 基清（ごとう もときよ、生年不詳 - 承久3年7月2日 (旧暦)（1221年7月22日））は、鎌倉時代初期の武将。
sen.e: Motokiyo GOTO (birth date unknown – July 22, 1221) was a busho in the early Kamakura Period.

Motokiyo GOTO (birth date unknown – July 29, 1221) was a busho (Japanese military commander) during the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正、bushoの補足追加、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 『尊卑分脈』によると実父は藤原秀郷流の嫡流とも言える佐藤義清（西行）の兄弟、佐藤仲清で、後藤実基の養子となった。
sen.e: According to the Sonpi Bunmyaku (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy), his biological father was Nakakiyo SATO who was the brother of Norikiyo SATO (Saigyo) and he became Sanemoto GOTO's foster son.

According to "The Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineage of the aristocracy), his biological father was Nakakiyo SATO who was the brother of Norikiyo SATO (Saigyo, who can be said to be a direct descendant of the FUJIWARA no Hidesato line), and he became Sanemoto GOTO's foster son.
sen.cmt: 「藤原秀郷流の嫡流とも言える」→訳漏れのため訳出対応しました。クォーテーションを追加し、"The Sonpi Bunmyaku"とし、余分なスペース消去

sen.j: 源頼朝に仕え、元暦3年（1185年）の屋島の戦いに参加。
sen.e: He worked for MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and participated in the Battle of Yakushima in 1185.
He worked for MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and participated in the Battle of Yakushima in 1185.
He worked for MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and participated in the Battle of Yashima in 1185.

sen.j: 同年、頼朝の許しを得ずに官位を得た事で、頼朝に「目は鼠眼にて、ただ候ふべきのところ、任官希有なり」と罵倒されている（『吾妻鏡』1185年（元暦2）4月15日条）。
sen.e: In 1185, he obtained a court rank without Yoritomo's permission, and was reviled by Yoritomo as "eyes that are meek like a mouse's and can only follow people, how could he get a position?" (Azumakagami, entry for April 15, 1185)

sen.cmt: Azuma Kagamiとし、クォーテーション・補足追加、日付を新暦表記に修正、一部シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 京都守護一条能保の侍でもあり、在京御家人として活躍するが、正治元年（1199年）源通親への襲撃を企て讃岐国守護を解任される（三左衛門事件）。
sen.e: He was a samurai for Yosiyasu ICHIJO, the Kyoto Shugo (military governor of Kyoto), and was active as a Kyoto gokenin (vassal), but in 1199, he planned an attack on MINAMOTO no Michichika and was dismissed as the Sanuki Province Shugo (Sanzaemon Incident)

sen.cmt: the Sanuki Province Shugo→the Shugo (provincial constable) of Sanuki Provinceとし、ピリオド追加

sen.j: その後、後鳥羽天皇との関係を深め、西面の武士・検非違使となる。
sen.e: Later, he deepened his relationship with Emperor Gotoba and became the Western Bushi, kebiishi (a police and judicial chief).

sen.j: 建保年間（1213年 - 1219年）から播磨国守護となる。
sen.e: He was Harima Province Shugo from 1213 to 1219.

sen.e: He was on the retired Emperor Gotoba side at the Jokyu Rebellion in 1221 and lost.

sen.j: その後幕府方についた子の後藤基綱に処刑された。
sen.e: Later he was executed by his child, Mototsuna GOTO, who was on the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) side.
